definitions: constituting number four in a sequence; 4th

examples.text: there were three bedrooms, with potential for a fourth
nearly three fourths of that money is now gone

definitions: the fourth finisher or position in a race or competition

examples.text: he could do no better than finish fourth

shortDefinitions: fourth finisher or position in race

definitions: the fourth (and often highest) in a sequence of a vehicle's gears

examples.text: he took the corner at the end of the road in fourth

shortDefinitions: fourth in sequence of vehicle's gears

definitions: the fourth grade of a school.
fourthly (used to introduce a fourth point or reason)

examples.text: third, visit popular attractions during lunch; fourth, stay late

definitions: an interval spanning four consecutive notes in a diatonic scale, in particular (also perfect fourth) an interval of two tones and a semitone (e.g., C to F).
shortDefinitions: interval spanning four consecutive notes in scale

definitions: the note which is higher by a fourth than the tonic of a diatonic scale or root of a chord.
